SEARCH
Package gw.pl.external.configuration

Interface ConfigPropertyChangeListener

public interface ConfigPropertyChangeListener
Callback for external configuration property changes.
Author:
akorostov

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final PropertyReloadReport

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    PropertyReloadReport
    propertiesChanged(long previousVersion, long newVersion, Map<String,Optional<String>> changes)
    Callback method to take action when any properties are changed, added or deleted by the external Config Service This method will never be called from parallel threads.
    default PropertyReloadReport
    sync(long currentVersion)
    Optional callback.

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_REPORT

      static final PropertyReloadReport EMPTY_REPORT

  • Method Details

    • propertiesChanged

      PropertyReloadReport propertiesChanged(long previousVersion, long newVersion, Map<String,Optional<String>> changes)
      Callback method to take action when any properties are changed, added or deleted by the external Config Service This method will never be called from parallel threads.
      Parameters:
      previousVersion - previous version of all the properties
      newVersion - latest global version of all the properties
      changes - properties that have been changed; key is property name, value is new property value, value is Optional.absent() if that property was deleted.

    • sync

      default PropertyReloadReport sync(long currentVersion)
      Optional callback. This callback is called periodically in the same thread as the propertiesChanged(long, long, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String>>) (so it is never called in the parallel with the propertiesChanged(long, long, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String>>)). It can can be used by the listener to do some sync/cleanup/catch-up etc. As an example, it could be used to handle possible race condition between propertiesChanged(long, long, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String>>) invocation and change of the internal state of the component in some other thread (it may help you to avoid some coarse grained synchronization in the implementation of the component). Unlike propertiesChanged(long, long, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String>>) which may be never called if external properties in the namespace do not change, this callback will be called every so often, e.g. 5-60 seconds.
      Parameters:
      currentVersion - current version of the external property.
